She hopes that through this loan and with her own stability, she will be able to earn more profit which will contribute to the success of her business as well as to improving the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sugar, spices and beverages.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
This is Paulina, forty-four, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Carlos, a technician, and she is the mother of one child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Paulina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Paulina hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ernalein

texts.en:
Ernalein is thirty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ernalein has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Ernalein has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Ernalein hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is fifty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Irma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Irma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is married to Abner, who works as a government employee. She is forty-five years old and is blessed with three children. Haydee, her eldest, is currently living in Jordan and working as a factory worker. Hayleen is finishing her studies. Absel, the youngest, is also in college. Sending them to college is very costly. Celia hopes that her children will finish their studies with her financial support. To help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their children, Celia began selling beauty soaps. She gets orders from people in her community and then purchases her products in Tumauini, Isabela. She also maintains a hog-raising business in their home. 

To further grow both of her businesses, Celia is requesting a loan of PHP 29,000 from Kiva lenders to buy additional pigs and buy sacks of feed for her hog raising business. She hopes to obtain a loan from lenders so her business can raise more capital. She plans to purchase stocks of beauty soaps and supplies of feed for her hogs to help them grow bigger. She hopes that her loan will be approved so that her businesses will remain stable.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional pigs for her business.

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is twenty-three3 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Jim provides motorela or motorcycle services. He is also into buying and selling clothing like t-shirts. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle services.

Jim has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jim hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle service.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, thirty-one, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jimmy, a technician. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Virginia hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise to sell in her business.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is thirty-five years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Clarisa sells fish like sardines and mackerel from her motorcycle. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Clarisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Clarisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Victoria

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora Blanca, se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 28 años, es Casada con 4 hijos solo 1 a su cargo y una nieta,  a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Blanca  atraviesa, es la necesidad de Comprar 4 Llantas para apoyar a su marido en una unidad de taxi, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de lo antes mencionado, y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica, which is in the department of León, Blanca works as an elementary school teacher in a small municipal school. She has been doing this work for 28 years. She is married with 4 children, only one of whom is still in her care, and 1 granddaughter, for whom she needs to provide the conditions they need to develop.
Something that Blanca needs is to buy 4 tires to support her husband who is a taxi driver. So, she has taken the decision to come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy the above mentioned tires, and so to improve their conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 4 tires.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is forty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Cristina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Shirley Gricela

texts.es: Shirley, de 35 años, habitante de la ciudad de León,  es dueña de un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en elaborar y vender hielo por  cantidad comercializa su producto en kiosko, refresquerías y comideria su negocio tiene 5 años, anterior mente se dedicaba a comercializar cosméticos. Su esposo la apoya en la distribución del producto tiene una camioneta como medio para transportar el hielo. Es madre de 2 hijos uno de 6 y 8 años ambos asisten a colegio de primaria. Ella Solicito el financiamiento para invertir en comprar  de un freezer nuevo y dar mantenimiento a los demás congeladores que tiene, su expectativa es crecer en su negocio y  hacerlo mas sostenible.
texts.en: 35 year old Shirley lives in the city of León and runs a small business making and selling ice in bulk. She sells to food kiosks, snack stands, and eateries. She has had the business for 5 years. She previously sold cosmetics. Her husband supports her in delivering the product and he has a van to transport the ice. She is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old and who both go to elementary school. She is requesting a loan to buy a new freezer and to maintain her other freezers. She expects to grow her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer and maintain her other freezers.

loans.name: Fridda Alicia

texts.es:
Fridda una mujer muy esforzada para lograr sus metas, continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogo, manifiesta seguir en la inversión para la mejora a su vivienda que con mucho sacrificio y con la ayuda de kiva ha venido construyendo; en este caso invertirá lo del crédito para la construcción de la pared de frente, misma que le dará mayor seguridad a su vivienda y evitara una serie de riesgos para ella y su familia. La señora López expresaba que su objetivo a futuro es mejorar todas las áreas  de su casa.
Agradece el apoyo constante de Afodenic y kiva  para mejorar el nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Fridda, a woman determined to achieve her goals, continues working in her catalog cosmetic sales business.  She plans to continue investing money to improve her dwelling that she has been constructing through help from Kiva and with much sacrifice.  In this case, she will invest the loan money in the construction of a front wall which will give her greater security in her home and avoid risks for herself and her family.  Mrs. Lopez' objective is to improve all areas of her house.

Fridda is grateful for the constant support of Afodenic and Kiva to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build a wall for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials to enclose her house.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna, comerciante y mujer con metas a futuro. Invertirle a su pulpería, es uno de sus objetivos en esta vida, ya que mediante su negocio propio ayuda a la sobrevivencia y progreso mismo de sus familiares. La señora Johanna, expresa que el financiamiento que se le otorgara en esta ocasión lo ocupara para la compra de granos básicos, tales como: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros y gaseosas, es por ello que agradece el apoyo brindado por kiva y la micro-financiera, que han sido un apoyo principal para su negocio.
texts.en: Johanna is a businesswoman with goals for her future.  One of her goals in life is to invest in her general store since through her own business she helps provide for the survival and progress of her family members.  Johanna will use the credit that will be granted on this occasion to buy basic grains, such as: rice, beans, and corn, amongst others, as well as sodas.  She is grateful for the support provided by Kiva and the micro-finance group. They have been a critical source of help for her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains to invest in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her grocery store's location.

loans.name: Harold Giovanny

texts.es: Harold, joven entusiasta, emprendedor y con muchas metas a futuro tiene la edad de 25 años, labora para una empresa privada, ocupando el cargo de Digitador de Nomina, uno de sus grandes sueños es llegar a ver la culminación de su cuarto razón por la cual está solicitando que se le otorgue el crédito. El joven manifestaba sentirse muy complacido por la oportunidad brindada que le están dando Afodenic y kiva quienes en conjunto y con el financiamiento dado harán que el mire su sueño hecho realidad, su plan a futuro es ver finalizada la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en: Harold is a young, enthusiastic entrepreneur with many future goals.  He’s 25 years old and works for a private firm as a Payroll Keyboarder.  One of his great dreams is to finish building his room which is why he’s asking for a loan.  The young man states that he feels very pleased with the opportunity Afodenic and Kiva are giving him who together and with the loan granted will lead to his dream becoming a reality.  His plan for the future is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Karla, vive en la ciudad de León,  es dueña de una pequeña pulpería desde hace más de 4 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a comercializar y vender ropa ambulante cansada del ritmo de trabajo bajo el sol y lejos de cuidar a sus hijos atender a su familia decidió emprender su pulpería con ayuda de su esposo inicio con una pequeña inversión vendiendo caramelos  y frutas, luego atravez de un financiamiento surtió su negocio poco a poco y actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos , avenas, verduras, huevo, leche , pan , enlatados , aceite, caramelos, productos para limpieza del hogar entre otros productos ya que su expectativa es crecer en su negocio y mejorar la educación y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Karla lives in the city of León; she has owned a small grocery store for more than four years.  She used to sell clothes in an ambulatory fashion but tired of the work rhythm under the sun and being unable to care for her children and family she decided to open a grocery store with help from her husband.  She started with a small investment selling candy and fruit.  Later on, through a loan was able to stock her store gradually and now is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, oats, vegetables, eggs, milk, bread, canned goods, oil, candy, home cleaning supplies, etc. since her expectation is to grow in business and improve her family’s education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 58 años y es viuda con 4 hijos que son Mayores de edad ya hicieron sus vida independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de comida que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de la Paz donde a la hora de almuerzo es muy lleno,  Este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución y Virginia utilizara este préstamo para compra de cocina para su negocio  y la  refacción del su puesto de venta, Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son Incrementar la venta de comida y tener mas clientes y ser mejor que la competencia, y así generar mas ingresos   y mejorar sus ventas, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Virginia is a 58 years old widow.  She has four adult children who are already living independently.  She sells food at a crowded market in La Paz that is very busy during lunch hour.  This is her first loan with the institution and she will use the loan to buy a stove for her business and to repair her sales stall.  The challenges that Virginia faces in her business are increasing food sales, gaining more customers, and being better than the competition so that she can generate more income.  She feels very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided through the granting of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and repair her sales stall.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 44, is married and has four children. She has a retail business selling a variety of products in her community. 

Margie is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She dreams of someday having her own stall so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, spices, shampoo, soap, and milk for her store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in Baybay Panalsalan, Plaridel. She is married and has one child. 

Gloria works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for eleven years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home's roof.

loans.name: Estación Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estación Cumbe está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes son amigos y vecinos, viven por la parroquia de Tarqui que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, en este lugar se encuentran un sinnúmero de haciendas ganaderas dedicadas a la producción lechera. El centro parroquial de Tarqui es un pequeño conjunto urbano, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, con una mezcla de la arquitectura moderna. Su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura, comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes plazas de trabajo, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores como nuestras socias que con el trabajo diario mejoran la economía de sus hogares y sacan adelante a sus familias, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Martha, es soltera y tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, su papá es de profesión sastre y su mamá se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

La Señorita. Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, actividad que ha iniciado con su primer crédito que realizo en el banco comunal, se dedica a su negocio de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para aumentar en su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Estación Cumbe” communal bank has five female members and one male member who are friends and neighbors living in Tarqui Parish in the south side of the city of Cuenca.  There are many dairy farms dedicated to milk production in this area.  Tarqui Parish’s center is a small urban enclave that maintains its traditional, native architecture mixed with modern architecture.  Its residents raise cattle, farm and are merchants and many work in the city in various types of jobs; they are noted for being very hard working like our members who with their daily labor improve the economy of their homes, support their families and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

One of the members of this group is Martha.  She’s single and 31 years old.  She lives in her parents’ house and shares household expenses with them. Her father is a tailor by profession and her mother is a farmer.  The house they live in is her parents’ property.

Martha works selling clothes via catalogue, an activity she started with the first loan she got in her communal bank; she works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed work schedule.

This is her second loan with her communal bank and she will use it to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes to increase business.  Her goal is to grow in business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child. 

Romeo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for sixteen years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

Romeo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for resale.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.  Ponciana has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 15,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Ponciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ponciana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita, 46 years old, is from the village of San Antonio. She is engaged in selling different vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage and fruits.  Pacita is a very responsible mother and wife.  She does everything to help her family and take care of the daily needs of her children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and bananas for her business. She hopes that someday she can finish her house for the convenience of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes and bananas for her food business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 
Yolanda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 9,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Versally

texts.en:
Versally is 55 years old and is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman. For more than twenty years she has been cooking and selling snacks such as pancit (a noodle dish) and other viands. She has sent her four children to school. She is very much thankful for having this business. It helps her a lot in improving her family’s living situation.

Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, pancit, and soft drinks. She is hoping that her sales will increase this time and that she could expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, pancit (a noodle dish), and soft drinks.

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Libertad en Progreso está formado por 15 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Victoria del Portete que esta localizada al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, lleva su nombre en honor a una batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del Portete, el 27 de Febrero de 1829. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades. Nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles y muy alegres, se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades las que les permiten a solventar los gastos de sus hogares, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Carmen, tiene 30 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y ha concebido 6 hijos de 12, 9, 7, 6, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora María Carmen se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y como pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en casa cría pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a ordeñar vacas actividad que la desempeña hace 6 meses, cultiva varios productos pero solo son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y  alimento para sus animales.

Su meta es construir su casa.
texts.en:
The “Libertad en Progreso” communal bank has 15 members who live around Victoria del Portete Parish located in the south side of the city of Cuenca.  It’s named in honor of a battle that occurred precisely on Portete’s foothills on 27 February 1829.  Its residents raise animals, farm and many go out every day to work in the city at various jobs.  Our members are kind, nice, very cheerful people.  They work in a variety of occupations that allow them to cover household expenses; they keep their people’s culture and traditions.

One of the group members is María Carmen, 30.  She is in a common law relationship and has had six children who are 12, 9, 7, 6, 4 and 3 years of age.  Her first four children attend the local little elementary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They do not own a house of their own; they live in a relative’s house.

María Carmen cares for her children and since she spends most of her time at home raises chickens and guinea pigs; she also milks cows, an activity she’s been in for six months.  She grows several products but they are for household consumption only.

She’s been in the communal bank for two years and will use her loan to buy chicks, guinea pigs and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy chicks, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
El señor Jose, de 65 años es originario de la comarca Mata Palo  localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor  actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años.  Esta actividad de siembra de maíz y tabaco la inicio por medio de unos amigos que junto pusieron capital y comenzaron a sembrar. El junto con sus cuatro hijos se dedican a las labores propias del campo y de esta manera se apoyan mutuamente para  salir adelante. 
El requiere el préstamo para compra de insumos, pago de mano de obra para sembrar una manzana de maíz de riego. Con este crédito podrá tener capital de trabajo para cubrir los costos de producción y espera obtener buenos rendimiento que le permitan cancelar su crédito y ampliar mas sus areas de siembra de maíz de riego.
texts.en:
José, 65, is from Mata Palo located in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí Municipality.  He’s a farmer by profession, an occupation he’s been in for the last 30 years.  He started this activity farming corn and tobacco through some friends who together raised capital and started to farm.  Together with his four children they do chores related to field work thus supporting each other to get ahead together.

He needs the loan to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs to plant a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of irrigated corn.  With the loan he will have the necessary working capital to cover production costs and he hopes to earn good profits that will allow him to repay the loan and expand the area of corn crops even more.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs to plant corn.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 45 years old.  He is married and has 3 children. He runs a bookstore to earn a living,  He has been in the business for 9 years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy books to sell.

loans.use: To buy books to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 
Bernadette has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of 10,000PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.  Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is married and has three children. Jennifer is 43 years old, and resides at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jennifer owns and operates a coconut production business, and she's been 12 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC.  In the future, Jennifer wants to make improvements to her house and she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Melie

texts.en:
Melie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 
Melie has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 12,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Melie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Melie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Ellen Rubi

texts.es:
Rubí es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, tiene 52 años, madre de 2 hijos los cuales tienen 25 y 28 años de edad y por los cuales ha trabajado mucho para sacarlos adelante sola ya que hace algún tiempo se separo del padre de sus hijos, actualmente vive solo con el menor de sus hijos ya que aun esta estudiando su carrera universitaria; uno de sus pasatiempos es la lectura y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, Rubí solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser contadora.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de cabinas de internet, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de once horas al día y puede atender hasta 55 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque la zona donde vive es muy transitada y por ello siempre tiene clientes.

Rubi agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar una computadora y 2 CPU para su negocio, con esta mejora podrá tener más clientela y poder tener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder ayudar a uno de sus hijos que está estudiando ingeniería de sistemas con los gastos de su graduación y con ello cumplir su gran sueño: “ Ver a su hijo especializarse en su carrera”.
texts.en:
Rubí is a very enthusiastic, hardworking woman.  She’s 52 years old and the mother of two children who are 25 and 28 years old for whom she’s worked hard to raise by herself since she separated from her children’s father some time ago.  She currently lives just with her youngest child who is studying a career at university.  One of her pastimes is reading and one of her favorite dishes is the very delicious “Ají de Gallina.” Rubí only completed fifth grade in secondary school but would have liked to study to be an accountant.

Rubí is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’ll be able to buy a computer and two CPUs for her business.  With this improvement she’ll be able to have more customers and higher income to improve her quality of life and be able to help one of her children study computer sciences and with graduation expenses to reach her great dream of: “Seeing her son specialize in a career.”

loans.use: to buy a computer and a CPU.

loans.name: Sibel

texts.en:
Sibel is a patient and ambitious woman who is married with a child. Sibel has been practicing management for four years. Her clients are her neighbors and relatives. While she thinks business is difficult, she thinks she has made considerable progress in her work. She turned a low budget grocery store into a market which she owns now.

This is her first loan from Maya. She will add the loan she gets from Maya to her capital to increase the variety of her products to better serve her clients. With this loan, she plans to make more sales and earn more money, which will enhance her business. 

"My husband has a job, and I work in the market," Sibel said. "I am hoping to get all the necessary goods required to be stocked in a market, and in the future I hope to turn my business into an even bigger market."

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Sibel, evli ve bir çocuğu var. Sibel, 4 yıldır işletmecilik yapıyor. Müşterileri  mahalle sakinleri ve çevresi. Ticaretle uğraşmanın kolay olmadığını düşünüyor ve çok aşamalar kaydettiğini söylüyor. Sermayesi çok az olan bir bakkaldan,şimdiki markete sahip olmuş.

Maya ‘dan ilk defa kredi kullanıyor. Maya’dan aldığı krediyi sermaye olarak kullanip ,müşterilere daha fazla çeşit ve hizmet sunmak istiyor. Eksik olan malzemelerini alınca, daha fazla satış yaparak daha fazla para kazanmasını ve büyümesini sağlayacak. Eşim çalışıyor ,bende markette bütün gücümle mücadele ediyorum. Bir markette olması gereken bütün ürünleri alıp ,ilerleyen zamanlarda daha büyük market olmayı planlıyorum. Sibel ,sabırlı ve hırslı bir kadın.

loans.use: to increase the variety of her products to better serve her clients.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 
Jocelyn has a shop that sells dried fish & squid per kilograms. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 12,000PHP to buy stocks of dried squid to sell.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried squid to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 
Linda is making & selling viands like chicken & pork adobo, caldereta & afritada. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.
Linda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Linda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 24 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel. She is married and has 3 children. 
Genelyn works in the fish industry and  catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase gasoline, hooks and nylon for her fishing boat. 
Genelyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Genelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, hooks and nylon for her fishing boat

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 
Cristina has a shop that sells dried fish & squid . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000PHP to buy stocks of dried squid & fish to sell.
Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried squid & fish to sell

loans.name: Yeraldin Yoana

texts.es:
Yeraldin es una joven de 22 años de edad, madre de una pequeña de 6 años de edad, al cual saca adelante sola y a la que ama muchísimo y es su razón de vivir, en su tiempo libre Yeraldin hace deporte y sobre todo siempre va acompañada de su pequeña; uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería, por ello trabaja muy duro para que su hija sea mejor que ella.

Yeraldin se dedica a la venta de chatarra (reciclaje de botellas de plástico, cobre y fierro), trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocida y los clientes siempre la buscan.

Yeraldin está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá comprar una balanza de 100 toneladas, lo que le permitirá tener una balanza en buen estado ya que la que tiene actualmente esta malograda, así podrá seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su casa de material noble y ya no seguir viviendo en su casa de tripley y darle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en:
Yeraldin is a young 22-year-old mother of a little six-year-old girl that she raises by herself and loves very much and who is her reason to live.  In her spare time Yeraldin plays sports and above all is always accompanied by her little girl.  One of her favorite dishes is the very delicious “Arroz Chaufa.” She only finished fifth year of secondary school but would have liked to study nursing.  She works hard so that her daughter will be better than her.

Yeraldin sells recyclables (recycles plastic bottles, copper and metal).  She works about 10 hours per day.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s well known and customers always seek her out.

Yeraldin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she’ll be able to buy a 100-ton scale that will allow her to have a scale in good working order since the one she currently has is broken so that she can continue working toward her big dream: “To have a house built with substantial materials and no longer live in a plywood house and to give her daughter a good education.”

loans.use: to buy a 100-ton scale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, from Olkalou, is 48 years old, married to Naomi, and the father of one child who is in school. A farmer for the past 10 years, John is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD. to buy fertilizers and potato seeds to add to his stock. In the future he hopes to be both a dairy farmer and a large-scale grower.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Rodrigo Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhas também casadas. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ele.

É carpinteiro há mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 9.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar madeira para a sua carpintaria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Jose was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and father of 2 daughters who are married.  He completed school through the 6th grade but dropped out due to his parents' financial situation.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he also supports a granddaughter who lives with him.  

Rodrigo Jose has been a carpenter for more than 8 years and earns around 9.500.000mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had a loan through another bank.  He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

He promises to make his payments on schedule.  In the future he plans to expand his business and intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand his carpentry business.

loans.name: Laura Tionila

texts.es: La Sra. Laura tiene 55 años y es soltera no tiene hijos se dedica a la venta de Ropa, su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona de Asana. Este préstamo es la primera secuencia que tiene dentro de la institución, La Sra. Laura usara este préstamo para Capital de Trabajo (Compra de Mercadería ropa de temporada), Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Hacer crecer el negocio generar mas ingresos. Laura  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  La competencia del mercado, y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida, la Sra. Laura desea tener una casa propia, para pasar sus años de vejes tranquila es su casita, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Laura is 55 years old.  She is single and does not have any children.  She sells clothing from a stand in the Asana area.  This is the first loan she has received with this institution.  She will use the loan as working capital to purchase seasonal clothing for sale.  She is requesting the loan to grow her business and generate more income.  Laura faces challenges with her business as there is a lot of competition in her market.  She will use the proceeds to improve her quality of life.  She would like to buy her own home, to have her own little place for when she gets old.  She is very thankful for the support provided by this institution.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 52-year-old married mother of three children, is from Lucsson Tudela, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Elizabeth has been in business for nine years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, a 30-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a shop that sells clothing including blouses, shirts and underwear for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of clothing for resale. In the future, Charity hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ana Balbina

texts.es:
Ana, vive en casa propia, junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de enchape y fantasía, ella inicio con este negocio por la necesidad de mantener ingresos para la familia, ayudando a su hijo en el estudio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un pedido de enchape de anillos, pulseras, cadenas, este préstamo le permitirá surtir el negocio y mejorar la atención a los clientes, teniendo más oportunidades de generar ganancias.
El objetivo de Ana es crecer con el negocio, tener un local fijo donde pueda instalar una joyería, para estabilizar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her 17 year old son.  She sells electroplated and costume jewelry.  She started this business because she needed to have an income for her family and to help her son with his education.  She is requesting a loan to purchase an order of electroplated rings, bracelets and necklaces.  With this loan she will be able to stock her business and improve her customer service.  This will provide more opportunities to earn profits. 

Ana's goal is to grow her business and be able to set up a shop for her jewelry business, and to stabilize her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase electroplated rings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon, a 39-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom are still in school, lives in Bor where she has been selling fish for four years. Amon heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and is now requesting her first loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase more fish to sell. She will use the extra income arising from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: 030502-Thôn Liên Hà-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Tuyến is 40 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 030502-Thôn Liên Hà-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2008, Tuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyến has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tuyến has been involved in her business for six years. The main hardship that Tuyến faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Tuyến hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia, age 59, is a widow who works hard to support herself. She has a business buying and selling vegetables and tobacco. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase vegetables and tobacco to sell in the market. She has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Dionisia would like to save money for her future, especially now that she is getting older and older. She prays for the expanding of her business in order to have a stable source of income now that she is alone.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and tobacco to sell in the market.

loans.name: Silvia Candelaria

texts.es:
Silvia, es comerciante de ropa, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos que son menores de edad, ella esta dedicada al comercio de ropa nueva, lo realiza de forma ambulante, todos los días de la semana.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, tambien comprara mochilas y peluches, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, surtiéndolo de más mercadería.
La aspiración de Silvia es la compra de lote de terreno para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos, tambien quiere a través del préstamo poder crecer con el negocio.
texts.en: Silvia sells clothes.  She lives with her husband and her two minor children.  She sells new clothes door to door, every day of the week. She is requesting a loan to purchase men's and women's underwear.  She will also purchase backpacks and stuffed animals.  This loan will help her improve her business by providing more merchandise for sale.  Silvia hopes to purchase a plot of land to leave to her children.  She also hopes to grow her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor, a responsible father who raised his family in a village, is 55 years old and has four grown children, all married and raising their own families. Through his patience and hard work, he has been able to support his family and educate his children. The owner and manager of a rice-farming business for almost 28 years, Amor usually earns a profit of P25,000 every harvest season.

Amor wants to improve his rice farming business to earn and save for the future and so is requesting a loan of P35,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the labor costs incurred in planting rice. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest this upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for the labor costs incurred in planting rice.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel  is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 
Russel makes and sells home-made sausage, or longganisa & chorizo. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 15,000PHP to buy raw ingredients in making home-made sausage.
Russel  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Russel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making home made sausage

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan has been operating her own small business from her home for years. She has experience in planting crops and she is also skilled in weaving palm leaves by hand. She has been in this business since she was a single girl. She turns leaves into furniture and roofing material to sell for a profit. 
Chan's husband, who is a domestic construction worker, moves from place to place around the province. She has nine children.   Seven of her children are married and live away from home, and the other two are single and study at a local school. 

Chan is taking out her loan to buy piglets for breeding purposes as well as to purchase more palm leaves for making roofing material.

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding as well as to purchase more palm leaves for making roofing material.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 
Nenita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 14,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 6 children. 
Marife has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Marife has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Marife hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and a mother of two children, aged eighteen and twelve years. She makes detergent and sells to the locals of Tala, a business she has done for the last three years.

With this loan, she plans to buy more chemicals and all the materials required for soap and detergent production. She hopes that the future will be bright and that she will be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for making more detergent for sale.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San, age 33, is a rice cultivator who lives in the Ang Snoul district of Kandal province. Besides farming business, he also works occasionally in the construction field as a domestic worker, generating more income to support his family with daily expenses. He has life partner in his wife who works as a garment factory worker and receives a formal salary every month.  They have two unmarried children and all of them still depend on the family income. San will use his loan to buy a calf for breeding and when it becomes big enough he could use it to serve in the farming business. In the future, San wants to be a leader of a construction worker team, to construct a new house, and to assist his kids in their education.

loans.use: to buy a calf for breeding and when it becomes big enough he can use it to serve on the farm.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek has been operating a farming business for over ten years. She plants rice and vegetable crops two seasons per year. She currently lives in Kompong Speu province with her husband and three single children. Two of her children are employed as local garment workers, while the other one is attending school. Her oldest child's wedding party will be occurring soon; Sek needs additional cash on hand to hold the party. She is requesting a loan to supplement her currently savings in order to celebrate the wedding party for her child.  In the future, she aims to increase her output from her crop-planting business, and help support her children with a higher education.

loans.use: to supplement her savings in order to celebrate a wedding party for her child.

loans.name: Ajah

texts.en:
Ajah lives in bor. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; two of her children are still in school. 

Ajah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 37, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Alan, her business partner, and a mother to her one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sell fire wood for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elna provides motorela or motorcycle services with  her husband as the driver. She is also has a retail store selling goods & snacks. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Elna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
Voeurn is 24 years old, a humble villager who comes from Kompong Speu province. She is married to her husband who works in the farming business. They grow annual crops, cultivating rice and earning an annual profit. This couple strives to work hard to ensure a standard of living because currently they don’t have any expenses from having children. Besides farming, Voeurn has spent her spare time at home running a small selling business.
Voeurn will use her loan to buy a cow and help maintain the rice field. With the balance of the funds, Voeurn will buy stock of merchandise to sustain her selling business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and help maintain a rice field.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 44 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Anita has a shop that sells viands such as chicken and pork adobo, caldereta & afritada. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 in order to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Anita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Lydia provides manicure & pedicure services to the community. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Kubatana Dangamvura Group

texts.en: This is 53 year-old Maria from Mutare. She is married with two children, one attending school.  Maria runs a retail business selling electrical products and clothes. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are liquidity. Maria has requested a loan of $800 in order to buy more electrical and clothes to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to assist in the upkeep of her family. In the future, Maria plans to have a self sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev is a 47-year-old single mother who has been residing in Ang Snoul district. She has been blessed with a child who works as a local construction worker. To earn a living, Khiev works as normal sewing staff for a garment factory and she always gets a salary monthly. She uses this for her daily expenses such as food, electricity, clothes and other financial expenses.

Khiev would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to add to her personal savings in order to mend some broken parts of her house as now it is getting old. From the requested loan, Khiev will be able to make her family live a more comfortable life than the previous time.

loans.use: to add to her personal savings to mend some broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married. She is a dealer, and her main activity is selling clothes and plastic wares.  She has twenty years of experience in managing this business. And for these years, she can say that their lifestyle as a family has improved.

At present, Victoria is asking for a loan of P15,000 in order to provide additional capital to buy more merchandise, such as women's and men's clothes, plastic wares and glass wares. She is buying a lot of stock because of this coming summer season where her offered products are in demand. She hopes to generate more income and also satisfy her customers with a greater variety of goods she offers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as women's and men's clothes, plastic wares and glass wares.

loans.name: Nyanjur

texts.en:
Nyanjur lives in bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; three of her children are still in school. 

Nyanjur heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 South Sudanese pounds (SDG) in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and married to Julio. They are blessed with three children: Julie, 28 years old, a college graduate who works as a call center agent; Julio, 24 years old, a college graduate who works as a nurse; and Janica, 16 years old, and in junior high school. 

Rosario says her canteen is situated in an urban area where there are many customers, especially during school days, because many high school and college students come to her store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more and varied food items to sell in the canteen. This will increase her customers' purchases and the number of customers who come to her business. 

“I dream of becoming a successful businesswoman someday so that I will be able to give my children a good future. That is why I really strive hard," Rosario says. She hopes that her grocery store will expand next to her canteen.

loans.use: To buy drinks, snack foods, canned goods, and coffee for her store.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roberta has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, siacoy, and bingka. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Roberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
This is Argie, 50, resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Patrocenio, a pensioner. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Argie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 8000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Argie hopes her business will grow more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: 010403-Thôn Xuân Phụ-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thăng has a retail business selling medicinal herbs. She is requesting a loan to purchase pharmaceuticals to resell. 

Thăng is 51 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 010403-Thôn Xuân Phụ-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province, and has one dependent.

In 2011, Thăng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thăng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thăng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thăng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thăng hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceuticals to resell.

loans.name: Sefu

texts.en: Sefu is 43 years old and married with two children. He sells bulbs, televisions and sockets to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan for 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy bulbs, televisions and sockets for sale.

loans.use: to buy bulbs, televisions and sockets for sale

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gertrudes provides manicure & pedicure services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures.

Gertrudes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 27, is a resident of Kompong Speu province and works as a local rice cultivator. He has been engaged in this farming business for many years and has a good experience from it. He married to his wife who currently plants variety of crops to earn a living. This couple has now a kid who still needs their support. 

San will be using this Kiva loan to purchase a cow to replace his old one. San wishes to purchase more farmland for the purpose of enlarging his crop-growing business. He also wants to repair his house and provide his children a further education.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to replace his old one.

loans.name: 010317-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ca operates a food stall/restaurant and sells shrimp sauce. She is requesting a loan to to purchase small shrimp and fish to make fish sauce.

Ca is 51 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 010317-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province, and has one dependent.

In 2012, Ca joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ca has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Ca has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ca faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ca hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase small shrimp and fish to make fish sauce.

loans.name: 030820-Thôn Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bảy has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to to purchase dry food to resell. 

Bảy is 42 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 030820-Thôn Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoá province, and has dependents.

In 2011, Bảy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bảy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Bảy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bảy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bảy hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to travel within the country for vacation.

loans.use: To purchase dry food to resell.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is 41 years old, married, and has a retail business. He has been in the business of selling feed and agricultural supplies for more than six years. These supplies are in demand, especially during farming season. This has caused Avelino to request a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, insecticides, and fertilizers as additional products to offer.

He is worried about the credit of some of his customers. However, because he is a hardworking and determined man, he has made the effort to collect the debts. Giving support to his customers, such as providing them with credit, is one of his techniques to acquire customers. 

Hopefully, he will be able to reap higher profits this time.

loans.use: To buy feed, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is from Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Wilfredo is married and has three children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Wilfredo has been in his business for 18 years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. In 2009, Wilfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to prepare for the next crop yield. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to pay for services to prepare the next crop yield

loans.name: Quinto

texts.en: Quinto is 28 years old and married. He sells vehicle spare parts to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan for 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts for sale

loans.name: Jose Rudy Agapito

texts.es:
José, se ha decido por otro préstamo, con la intensión de iniciar el nuevo cultivo de maíz, para esto necesitara comprar abono y semilla mejorada, que será la inversión que realizara con este préstamo. 
El considera que su labor en la agricultura ha mejorado a través de la utilización de los préstamos, su cosecha anterior fue provechosa y espera que este nuevo ciclo sea igual.
texts.en:
José decided to get another loan with the intention of starting a new corn crop. For this he will need to purchase fertilizer and enhanced seeds, and that's the investment he will make with this loan.
He believes that his farming work has improved with the loans. His previous harvest was profitable and he hopes that this new cycle will be the same.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and enhanced seeds.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old. He is married to Margaret, and together they have one child. He sells shoes and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first term loan in KADET Ltd. He was brought to KADET Ltd. by our client. He will use the loan amount to purchase more shoes for sale. John hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with six children. 

Nancy is providing motorela, or motorcycle, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for gasoline for motorcycle services.

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. 

Roche has a shop that sells coconuts for copra, or dried coconut meat. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy coconuts to sell.

Roche has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roche hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
This is Elvis, 37, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Irene, his business partner, and mother to their three children. Elvis, together with his wife, manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his children’s schooling. 

Elvis operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are the local community. He earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Elvis hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 32 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are still in school. 

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um is a 56-year-old married man and a loving father of six children, residing in Kompong Speu province. Currently three of his children are working in different occupations making and income, and they often contribute their salary with Um to satisfy and cover the family’s needs. The remaining children are attending school and living under his support.  His wife also assists him in his business. From their farming business, the couple is able to make an average income of USD$1.30 each day; they use it for other expenses.

Um is asking for his first loan to buy a new motorbike for his children to commute to workplaces as well as use for the traveling needs of his family. With the remainder, Um will purchase small piglets for raising.

In the future, he expects to go on to buy more piglets for breeding and support his children to finish high school and university degrees.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for his children to commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and is from Olkalou. He is married to Zipporah, and they have two children, both of whom are in school.

Joseph is a farmer. He has been in the business for the past six years. His third loan from KADET Ltd. will enable him buy four dairy cows, fertilizers, and spraying chemicals.

Joseph hopes to diversify into cattle-rearing in the future.

loans.use: To buy four dairy cows, fertilizers, and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is from Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married, and has six children. 

Mary Grace owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been in the business for 16 years and earns 3500 PHP a month. 

Mary Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 9600 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
Carlina is 47 years old and has four grown-up children. She commonly uses her motorcycle transport to generate additional income. She plans to earn and save more income to start another business and support the education of her grandchildren. 

Carlina has been a tricycle operator for almost six years and usually earns a profits of 6000 PHP a month, which she spends on food, clothing, and her grandchildren's allowances. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her business and hopes that, someday, she will start and manage another business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph Mutema

texts.en:
Joseph is still involved in farming, and the business is doing great. 

This is Joseph's third loan from KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the funds to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use as spraying chemicals for his farm. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by staff members. 

He hopes to see his business grow and help him to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Marvin Gabriel

texts.es:
Marvín, vive acompañado de su familia, es agricultor y ganadero, tiene 7 años de estar en el negocio, aprendió de su padre esta labor, la realiza a diario con mucho entusiasmo ya que este oficio le gusta mucho.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos terneros, para aumentar su ganado, este préstamo contribuirá para mejorar su hato ganadero, tambien que así lograra realizar una buena inversión.
La aspiración de Marvín es desarrollarse en esta actividad, que le sea rentable y que a través de este pueda cancelar bien el préstamo, y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Marvín, who lives with his family, is a farmer and rancher. He has been in business for seven years and learned these trades from his father. Every day he works with great enthusiasm because he enjoys what he does.

Marvín is requesting a loan in order to buy two calves so that he can increase his cattle herd. This loan will improve his ranching business in hopes of achieving a good investment. Marvín aspires to develop his business so that it becomes profitable. As a result, he will be able to successfully repay his loan and move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 42, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP)-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.
