To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 47,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Miech

texts.en: Miech is 26 years old, a mother of one child and a resident of Kompong Speu province. She is a local farmer, cultivating crops along with her spouse, especially rice. She has been in the farming business since 2006.  Her earnings from her rice crop-planting business are a bit low to cover her daily expenses. Miech would like a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy cows for her farming because in previous years she used to hire other villager’s animals to work on her farm. She is very appreciative of all lenders. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income next year.

loans.use: to buy cows for her farming

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is from the village of Guibang. She is 58 years old. Josie is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josie is asking a loan of 28,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and noodles for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and noodles for her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with four children.  

Betty operates a service-based business, providing transportation to local community members, to earn a living. She's been doing this for 10 years earns 8000 PHP every month from her work. 

Betty is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle she uses in her business. 

Betty joined GDMPC in 2005 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Betty hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, age 53, is a domestic rice farmer from Kompong Speu province. She is able to earn a suitable profit from this business. However, it seems rarely enough to cover her daily costs. Her husband works as a chief villager in his community. Mao is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a plot of fertile farmland for expanding her rice crop-planting business. The couple has three children, all of whom are single and employed in various jobs.

loans.use: to buy a plot of fertile farmland for expanding her rice crop-planting business.

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine is 35 years old and married, with three children. He does welding to earn a living. Martine has been in the business for 11 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since Martine joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is a married woman with seven children. Melita is 53 years old and resides in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Melita used her last loan to purchase products to resell. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In the future, Melita hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old. She is married to Wilson. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is Leonida's first term loan. She was brought to KADET Ltd. by a KADET client. She will use the loan amount to purchase charcoal stock for resale.

Leonida hopes to venture into the real-estate business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Due to financial burden, Fidel is aiming to improve his rice farming business to support his family and finance the education of his four children. He has been a farmer for almost 25 years and usually earns a profit of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in every harvest season. He utilizes his income to satisfy the necessities and allowances of his children. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Fidel planned to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production. But due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional amount of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice. He believes that he can increase his production and income through his patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost incurred in planting rice

loans.name: Nhcek

texts.en:
From the province of Kompong Speu, Nhcek, 55, a mother of a three children, grows some kinds of crops on rented farmland to generate income for her livelihood. Her husband always assists her in the business. Together, they are able to earn approximately USD$1.30 each day to cover their daily expenses.

Nhcek would like to take out a loan from HKL to buy a cow for her farm and build a toilet in her backyard to ensure a healthier living. This loan will enable her to sustain her farming business. With the increase in income, Nhcek will use it to support her last born child’s education.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm and build a toilet in her backyard to ensure a healthier living.

loans.name: Fathima

texts.en:
Fathima is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. She runs a sari-sari store where she sells vegetables, snacks, and spices. She has been in this business for three years and has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell. 

She works hard to provide for her family. This is the only source of income she has because she was not able to enter college. Fathima is proving to her family that she is worth it.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single lady lady, aged 25 years old, and supports her one child.  She operates a food stall in Chemundu Trading Centre and has been in operation for a period of two years. Ruth earns a monthly income of 5500 KES.

Ruth is requesting her third loan of 25,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and wishes to use this amount to purchase five bales of wheat flour, four bales of maize flour, 50 kilograms of sugar and four packet of tea leaves. She will use the anticipated profit to repay the loan.

Ruth hopes to expand her business and start the same business in a different location.

loans.use: To purchase five bales of wheat flour, four bales of maize flour, 50 kilograms of sugar, and four packet of tea leaves.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, es comerciante de ropa nueva, medicinas y accesorios, vive con su esposo en casa propia, no tienen hijos, ella aprendió el comercio por su propia cuenta, tiene 4 años en él, tiene un local en el mercado donde atiende a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, blusas y camisas formales para caballeros, esta inversión le ayudara para tener mayor disponibilidad en el negocio y que sus clientes le prefieran.
El objetivo de Sandra es mejorar el nivel del inventario, desarrollándose en el negocio, para lograr mejores ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Sandra is a merchant who sells new clothing, medicines, and accessories. She and her husband live in their own home. Sandra learned this trade on her own and has been in business for four years. She has a shop at the market where she attends to her customers.

Sandra is requesting a loan in order to buy new clothing such as skirts, dresses, undergarments, blouses, and formal shirts for men. This investment will help increase the available inventory of her business and provide what her customers prefer. Sandra's goals are to improve her inventory, develop her business, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as skirts, dresses, undergarments, blouses, and shirts.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
El trabajo de educación requiere de mucho sacrificio y seguimiento en la enseñanza aprendizaje, Consciente de esto,  El señor Pedro se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria en una comarca del municipio de Quezalguaque,  atendiendo a niños de varias edades en la primaria  y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación y el mejoramiento de los niveles de vida.
El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una Motocicleta,  Esto con el fin de asegurar el transporte a su centro trabajo como es el centro educativo de una comarca de Quezalguaque y el viaja de telica hasta ahí, ya que el medio de transporte es bastante escaso y esta inversión le vendría a garantizar el nivel de puntualidad y por ende la enseñanza misma, ya que también viene a mejorar su nivel de vida que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en: Working in education requires a lot of sacrifice in the pursuit of teaching and learning. Being aware of this, Pedro is dedicated to his work as an elementary school teacher in a district of the city of Quezalguaque. He cares for children of various ages at the elementary school and his primary concern is educating these people, since they are the future of the nation, and also improving living conditions. He turns to Ceprodel because he wishes to request a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle. The goal of this is to ensure that he will get transportation to work, since he works at an educational center in a district of Quezalguaque and he commutes from Telica to there. The means of transportation are scarce and this investment would ensure a good level of punctuality, and it would therefore ensure teaching itself. It will also improve his living conditions, which he so needs, both for his own sake and his family's sake.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle in order to commute to his teaching work.

loans.name: Battungalag

texts.en:
Borrower Battungalag, a 23-year-old married mother of a one-year-old son, lives with her family in a small apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her father-in-law babysits her newborn son.

Although her education is in business administration and accounting, Battungalag supports her family by operating a clothing-sales business at the local indoor market. She usually sells bags, shoes, women's clothes and other goods purchased from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China that she travels to once a month. Her spouse operates a home cleaning business, but sometimes helps her.

Battungalag is requesting a 3.900.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a variety of clothes, shoes, and bags for the upcoming spring season, a time of strong shopping activity in Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella ha instalado una tienda de productos domésticos en la casa de habitación, tambien vende prendas enchapadas, esta tiene 12 años de existir su horario es de 8:00am hasta las 4:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos no perecederos, como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, ya que con ellos surtirá el inventario para mantener mayor disponibilidad.
Con esta compra espera que mejore su situación y que las ventas le aumenten, pues aspira tener un negocio más grande por lo que quiere realizar una buena inversión.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and one daughter. She has set up a store selling home products in the house where she lives. She also sells plated jewelry. This business has been in existence for 12 years. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy non-perishable products, such as rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil, since with these she can increase her inventory and offer better availability. 

With this purchase, she hopes to improve her situation and increase her sales. Her aspiration is to have a larger business, and for this reason she wants to make a good investment in it.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela. She is married with three children. 

Alicia has a general store that sells a variety of products. Alicia has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old and married with five children. He does bicycle repairs to earn a living. He has been in the business for 15 years and has employed three people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bicycle tires and chains.

loans.use: to buy bicycle tires and chains.

loans.name: Martha Ruth

texts.es:
Marta, vive con dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, refrescos, charamuscas, choco bananos, entre otros productos que son fáciles de realizar, esta venta la realiza en su casa, desde hace tres años, su horario es de 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente Marta solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, para la elaboración de las tortillas, tambien comprara frutas como sandias, banano, piña, para refrigerarlas y mezclarlas con chocolate,  formando los productos como choco banano, choco sandia, ya que son del gusto de los clientes.
Ella quiere que con este préstamo tener la oportunidad de crecer y mejorar su condición, desarrollándose y creando mas solvencia económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta lives with two children, aged 8 and 12. Her work is selling tortillas, soft drinks, charamuscas [fruit smoothies in plastic bags], and choco-bananas, among other simple products. She makes these sales from her house, and she has operated this business for three years. Her hours are from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

Currently, Marta is requesting a loan to buy corn to prepare tortillas. She will also buy fruits such as watermelons, bananas and pineapples to refrigerate and mix with chocolate to form products such as choco-banana and choco-watermelon, since they are favorites among the customers. 

With this loan, she wants to have the opportunity to grow and to improve her condition, to develop herself and to create more economic solvency for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn to prepare tortillas.

loans.name: Live Show Group

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Nyasha from Mutare. She is married with four children, three of whom are attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Nyasha runs a retail business, selling clothes. The business has been in operation for several years. She says the main challenges faced are high cost of clothes. Nyasha has requested a loan of $600 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Nyasha plans to own a clothing shop in the Central Business District of Mutare.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sunyata

texts.en:
Sunyata, 40, is from the Alinguigan province of Isabela. Sunyata is engaged in selling a variety of products in her village, such as soap, drinks and snack foods. Sunyata is asking a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy additional products that she can offer in her village. 

Sunyata dreams that she can expand her business to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, noodles, spices and soap for her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old. He is married to Esther and together they have two children. He operates a general shop and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first term loan in KADET LTD. He was brought to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan amount to purchase drinks, braids, sugar and phone accessories for his business.

He hopes to expand his business in terms of space and stock in the near future.

loans.use: purchase stock of drinks, braids, sugar and phone accessories for his business.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in this business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has no children. 

Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500, in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en: Benigna is 46 years old with five adult-aged children, and she is married to Jhony from the village of Aliguigan Province of Isabela. She manages a furniture shop, where she can sell tables and chairs in the town. Benigna is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy wood and materials for her shop. Benigna hopes in the future her business can expand to serve the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials that she can use in her business.

loans.name: Anne Lee

texts.en:
Anne Lee is 43, married and has three school-age children. With her husband, they agreed to educate their three children and give them a better life. Anne Lee engages in load retailing and selling of AVON and Natasha products to generates additional income while her husband works as a jeepney driver. She has been operating her business for almost five years and earns a profit of 5,000 PHP a month. 

She aimed to continue and improve the business to increase her income, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy load wallet and additional stocks of AVON and Natasha products for sale. She believes that through hard work, she will improve the business and hopes that someday, they will become financially stable and their children will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy load wallet and additional stocks of AVON and Natasha products for sale

loans.name: Nyantiop

texts.en:
Nyantiop lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 27 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyantiop heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old. She is a tailor and has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of 20,000 KES from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was brought to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan amount to purchase sewing materials such as threads, needles, and fabric for making dresses.

Her dream is to venture into the real estate business in the future.

loans.use: purchase sewing materials, like threads, needles, and fabric for making dresses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El  señor Juan  tiene como actividad  principal la confección de trajes para caballeros y damas, en su sastrería que se encuentra ubicado en una de las zonas mas concurridas de la ciudad de El Alto, es casado y con su esposa tienen 3 hijos la esposa se dedica se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno,  el momento de la visita se encontraba  confeccionando trajes,  esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito de financiamiento para la compra de tela  para confeccionar trajes ya que tiene muchos pedidos, el Sr. Juan es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación desea con el tiempo tener un taller mas grande y contratar mano de obra, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan's main activity is sewing garments for gentlemen and ladies in his tailor's shop, which is located in one of the busiest areas of the town of El Alto. He's married, and he and his wife have three children. His wife raises cattle. At the moment of the visit, he was sewing clothing, which is their main source of income. On this occasion, he requests the loan in order to purchase fabric for making garments, since he has a lot of orders. Juan is a very hardworking person with the drive to overcome. In time, he wishes to own a larger shop and hire employees. He feels very thankful to the institution for the support he's been given.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make garments.

loans.name: 040403-Thôn Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Viên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Viên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. 

Viên is 58 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 040403-Thôn Hải Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2002, Viên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Viên has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Viên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Viên hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, solamente él trabaja en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, aprendió este oficio por su padre, lo realiza en el terreno donde vive, no tiene un horario fijo porque es una dedicación diaria en la que unos días pueden ser mas trabajosos.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaca y dos terneros y además los materiales para iniciar la siembra de maíz como el abono y los herbicidas, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en ganado y poder realizar el cultivo.
El objetivo de Juan es mejorar su desempeño, realizando una buena cosecha y en el área ganadera seleccionar y mantener buen ganado.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children, and only he  does the farm work and raises livestock. He learned this trade from his father, and does it on the piece of land where he lives. He doesn't have fixed hours because his work is done on a daily basis, and some days he works harder than others.

He is applying for a loan to buy a cow and two calves, as well as supplies to begin planting corn, such as fertilizer and herbicides. This purchase will help him add to his cattle herd and grow his crop. Juan's goal is to improve his output, by producing a good harvest; and with regard to his livestock, by selecting and maintaining good cattle.

loans.use: To buy a cow and two calves, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is married with one child, who is one year old. His wife works as a farmer. Christophe has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to obtain this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and seeds, and pay labor support costs.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 35 years old and is a food stall owner in Kilifi. He is married and the father of five children. His business has been in operation for the past ten years, and it is doing great.

This marks his third borrowing from KADET LTD., to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted food items and serving dishes. 

He hopes to get profits from his expanded business, which he will use to educate his children. His dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted food items and serving dishes.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years old, and married with four children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years, and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dryer machine and a hair drying machine.

loans.use: to buy a hair blow dryer and a hair drying machine.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 39 years old, a married woman who lives comfortably with three of her children in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hard-working woman with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. 

She has been operating a beauty salon that provides more generalized services related to skin health, facial aesthetics, foot care, even meditation and other services. She acquires all needed items on regular trips to the capital. She serves her customers with a very friendly and amenable manner which means they are loyal to her and recommend her to others, increasing her customer base.

She started her business with a small amount of capital provided by her father until she was able to be a professional hairdresser. Now she has been working alone. She describes her business as profitable, as it provides her with good earnings, and she is able to sell all her products.

 Due to her desire to generate her own income,  Khadija requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to  invest in buying a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo and make-up, artificial hair and combs.

In the future, she dreams that her business will continue to provide income in order to help her family with the household income, and in that way, provide a better quality of life. She also dreams of having a big store where she could hire many girls who are in need of work over there.

loans.use: to  invest in buying a variety of cosmetic creams, shampoo and make-up, artificial hair and combs for her business.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is married with seven children aged between 6 and 22 years. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. Theoneste has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Nelvie

texts.en:
Nelvie is a hardworking, diligent and careful person. She is married and is raising four children. She has bought and sold meat in the market for over 20 years. She always brings in fresh and attractive products to get the attention of buyers.

To continue these services, she is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fresh meats to sell. She hopes through this loan, improvement of her family's life will be attained.

loans.use: to buy fresh meats to sell.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is married with five children aged between 1 and 15 years. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. Theoneste has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and seeds, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deogracias is 30 years old, married and a vendor living at Capatan. With his spouse, he sells fruits, vegetables and grocery items to the people in their village. They have been in this business for almost four years and usually generate PHP 3,000 each month.

As of now, Deogracias has insufficient funds and that is why he is asking for the loan of PHP 30,000 to increase the inventory of mechandise he is offering. He will buy onions, cabbages, canned goods, soft drinks and breads to sell. 

Deogracias and his wife don't have any children yet, but pray to have one in the future. He is also praying for good health and a good relationship towards his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy onions, cabbages, canned goods, soft drinks and breads for resale.

loans.name: Ma'amon

texts.en:
Ma'amon is a 35-year-old married man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child.

Ma'amon has a barber shop and he is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed.
 
Ma'amon is looking to establish another branch of his shop and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines needed

loans.name: Suhaila

texts.en:
Suhaila is a 54-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Suhaila is a tailor and she has a home-based project which started years ago with only one sewing machine. Now she is requesting a loan of 300 JD to purchase raw materials such as fabrics and thread.

Suhaila is looking to move her business out of her home into a shop to enlarge her customer base and increase her income with an aspiration of purchasing a home for the family instead of their current rented one.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (fabrics and thread)

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Selling grocery items to the people in her village allows Carmelita to sustain her family's need for daily meals. Income generated from the business has been very minimal, so she needs to improve her sales to increase her earnings. 

Carmelita has insufficient funds, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, bottled beverages, eggs and sugar to sell in her store. She would like to earn consistent profits from the business to meet all the needs for the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bottled beverages, eggs and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a public servant. He is a Barangay official (smallest unit of town) at Capatan. Aside from being an official, he runs a store with his wife as his partner. They have been operating their store for almost five years. They usually earn about PHP 3,000 each month. The couple has three children who attend school. 

Avelino is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more grocery items, such as noodles, detergent, soap, eggs and breads to sell. 

Someday, Avelino would like to earn consistent profits from the business and continuously extend good public service to the locals.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, such as noodles, detergent, soap, eggs and breads to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites lives in Solana with Raymundo, her spouse, and a daughter who is attending school. The family lives are less fortunate. Instead of being lazy at home, Marites runs a store selling grocery items in her neighborhood. This way, she can add to her spouse's income, which is derived from a farming business. 

Marites needs to increase the quantity of nerchandise she offers, in order to acquire more sales from the business, but she has inadequate capital to buy merchandise. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy milk, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, breads and eggs to sell. 

In the future, Marites would like to continue growing as a businesswoman for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, breads and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is married with two children. Paz is 22 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Paz has been in this business for three years. 

Paz has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional feed for hog fattening. 

Paz has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for hog fattening.

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en:
Ebtesam is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her son.

Ebtesam is a 34-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Ebtesam has a home-based project: she sells home products and is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Ebtesam is looking to establish her own store so that she can increase her income and improve her family's living  conditions.

loans.use: to purchase home products for business purposes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 48 años, se dedica  ala elaboración y venta de comidas,  es casada con un hijo que tiene 8 años de edad, se encuentra estudiando, su puesto de venta de comidas se encuentra en la zona de la mutualista este préstamo es su segunda secuencia  dentro de la institución y  la Sra. Carmen va a usar este préstamo para compra de frízer para su negocio Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por que es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir creciendo y a la vez elaborar en mayora cantidad, para tener mayor ventas y mas clientes y  utilizara El frízer para poner todas sus verduras y carnes, ya que tiene mayor capacidad. La Sra. Carmen se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen is 48 years old and works making and selling food.  She is married with one 8-year-old child who studies.  Her food stall is in the Mutualista area.  This loan is her second sequence with the institution and she is going to use it to buy a freezer for her business.  She is requesting this loan because she is a hardworking and enterprising person.

The challenges she faces in her business are to continue growing and at the same time to make food in greater quantities, to have greater sales and more customers.  She will use the freezer for all her vegetables and meats because it has a greater capacity.

Carmen is very grateful for the opportunity they are giving her by granting her the loan.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Abla is conservative person so she is unwilling to upoad her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Abla is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Abla has an exceptional talent in decorating with flowers. She uses her talent and improves it to provide her family with an adittional source of income to provide them with better living conditions.

Abla is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials needed for her flower decorations business.

Abla is looking to expand her business and purchase a home for the family in addition to providing her children with a proper education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for her flower decorations business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, имеет дочь 4 года. Вот уже 15 лет, как он занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах. Виктор выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Он вырос в селе и знает этот бизнес очень хорошо. Виктор предприимчив и целеустремлен. На данный момент у него есть 5 больших теплиц. Но он не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом, а планирует развиваться дальше.

Виктор просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000  гривен на установку отопления в двух теплицах. Для этого ему нужно закупить нагревательный котел, провести трубы, закупить топливо. Отапливаемые теплицы дают более ранний урожай, который можно продать по более выгодной цене. Дополнительную прибыль Виктор планирует использовать для улучшения жилищных условий для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Victor is married and has a four-year-old daughter.  For 15 years already he has been growing vegetables in greenhouses.  Victor grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes.  He grew up in the village and knows this business very well.  Victor is enterprising and goal-oriented.   At the present time, he has five large greenhouses, but he is not satisfied with what he has achieved and is planning to develop his business further.  

Victor is asking for a loan of 20,000 hryven to install heating in two greenhouses.  To do this, he needs to buy a boiler, lay the piping, and buy fuel.  Heated greenhouses enable an earlier harvest, which one can sell for a more advantageous price.  Victor is planning to use the additional profit to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to install heating in his greenhouses

loans.name: Wilfredo Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilfredo, vive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de lotería, tiene ya tres años en este negocio, quien se lo enseño fue su madre, y hoy en día es el negocio que le genera las ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos series de billete de lotería, ya que por el momento no tiene la facilidad de adquirirlos, este préstamo le dará a Wilfredo la oportunidad de continuar en su negocio, sin descuidar a los clientes y manteniéndose para mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de Wilfredo es que su familia cuente con una condición más solvente, apoyar su hijo durante su crecimiento para que en un futuro sea una persona útil con buena educación.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives with his wife and his three-year-old daughter. He has been selling lottery tickets for three years. He learned the business from his mother and today it generates the profits that allow him to afford his home expenses.
He requests the loan in order to purchase two series of lottery tickets, because at the moment he doesn't dispose of the means to buy them. This loan will give Wilfredo the opportunity to go on with his business without neglecting his customers and to get by so that he can increase his sales.
Wilfredo wishes for his family to become financially settled. He also wishes to support his son in his development so that he becomes a valuable person with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase two series of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven de 27 años la cual vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo en el verano se realiza la vendimia que es la cosecha de la uva para la elaboración del Pisco y del Vino y en la cual se realiza un festival de celebración en el mes de Marzo; como buena peruana le gusta mucho cocinar  y uno de sus platos favoritos son los tallarines sobre todo porque su pasatiempo es cocinar y por ello siempre disfruta de este platillo, es madre de un pequeño de 8 años el cual va a ingresar a la escuela este año y al cual ama muchísimo y por el cual da la vida por verlo feliz.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas, ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 6 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es la única que vende estos productos en su barrio y porque tiene buena sazón.

Jenny está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio (embutidos, papa, especerías), así como también poder comprar los útiles escolares de su hijo, así ella podrá tener mercadería para elaborar sus platillos y podrá solventar los gastos de la escuela de su pequeño, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y seguir luchando para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young 27 year old woman.  She lives in Ica, a city characterized by its year-round warm climate.  The grape harvest for the production of Pisco (grape brandy) and wine takes place here in the summer, and they hold a festival in March to celebrate this event.  Like a good Peruvian, she enjoys cooking very much and one of her favorite dishes of all is “tallarines” (noodles). Cooking is her pastime and she always enjoys making this dish.  She is the mother of a little 8 year old who is entering school this year.  She loves him very much and she dedicates her life to making him happy.  

She sells hamburgers and “salchipipas” (thinly sliced pan-fried beef sausages and French fries) and puts a lot of effort into her business.  She dedicates about six hours per day to her business and may serve up to 35 customers per day.  She believes her business is going well because it is the only one in her neighborhood that serves these products and they have good flavor.

Jenny is very grateful for the Kiva loans. With the support that they offer she will be able to purchase goods for her business (sausages, potatoes, spices), and also buy school supplies for her son.  So, she will have ingredients to create her dishes and also be able to pay for her son’s school expenses. This will allow her to continue working and striving to fulfill her greatest dream, “to have her own local and provide her child with a good education”.

loans.use: to purchase goods (sausages, potatoes, spices, and other products) and school supplies.

loans.name: Ever Enrique

texts.es:
Ever, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, viven en casa propia, él está dedicado a la agricultura y al cuido de ganado, tiene ya 10 años de estar en este trabajo, lo aprendió por medio de su padre.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para aplicarlos al cultivo como el abono y herbicidas, porque está iniciando la siembra de maíz, esto le ayudara para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras,  ya que aplicara los recursos necesarios.
La aspiración de Ever es a través del trabajo mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, ya que dependen de él, además de formar a sus hijos para el futuro.
texts.en:
Ever lives with his family, his wife and two children, ages 6 and 3.  They live in their own house.  He works in agriculture and taking care of livestock.  He has been doing this job for ten years already.  He learned it from his father.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy materials to apply to his crop, such as fertilizer and herbicide, because he is starting the corn planting.  This will help him to improve the productivity of his land because he will apply the necessary resources.

Ever's goal is to improve his family's living conditions through his work, because they depend on him.  He also wants to prepare his children for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene 41 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  17,12 y 8 años, se dedica al Tejido de mantas de alpaca, ella vive en la  comunidad de Cachilaya  los Andes, este es su primer préstamo dentro dela institución, La Sra. Cristina va a usar este préstamo  para compra de lana de alpaca para su negocio, ya que tiene pedidos que entregar,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de recursos. La Sra. Cristina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar en su actividad. va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar su  capital de trabajo y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Cristina is 41 years old. She's married and has three children aged 17, 12 and 8. She lives in the community of Cachilaya dos Andes and she knits alpaca blankets. This is her first loan with the institution. Cristina will use the loan to purchase alpaca wool for her business, since she's got orders to meet. The reason she requests this loan is the lack of means. Cristina faces the challenge of making progress in her business. She will use the rewards to increase her working capital and therefore increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool to knit alpaca blankets.

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en:
Khatoon is a 46-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Khatoon sells blankets and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Khatoon is looking to establishing a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for business purposes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, 55 years old, is from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Mary and they have two children, both in school. John has been a farmer for the past 35 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings. John hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más chatarra y plásticos, cobre y aluminio, este nuevo financiamiento le ayudara para mantener el dinero necesario y salir en busca de los materiales que recoleccióna para luego revender, esto le ayudara para mantenerse.
El considera haber tenido una buena experiencia con su préstamo anterior, pues sus ventas fueron mejores y su familia se encuentra más estable. 
Este es su segundo prestamo con la institucion.
texts.en:
José is asking for another loan for the purcahse of more scrap metal and plastic, copper and aluminum. This new loan will help him to make the money he needs and go out looking for the materials he will collect to later resell. This will help him keep going. 

He feels like he had a good experience with his last loan, since the sales were better and his family became more stable.

This is his second loan with the organization.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal and plastic, copper and aluminum.

loans.name: Shofa

texts.en:
Shofa is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her brother.

Shofa is a 38-year-old woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. Shofa sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more quantities.

Shofa is looking to expand her home-based business by establishing her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for use in her business.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья замужем, имеет одну дочь. У Натальи есть свой бизнес. Она продает детскую одежду, в том числе одежду для новорожденных. Спрос постоянный, так как рядом есть родитльное отделение больницы. Наталья привлекает покупателей хорошим качеством товара и умеренными ценами.

Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит 5,000 гривен для закупки товара и увеличения ассортимента весенной одежды.
Бизнес цель Натальи - увеличить свои обороты, что позволит ей закупать товар по более низким ценам.
texts.en:
Natalya is married and has one daughter.  Natalya has her own business.  She sells children's clothing, including clothes for newborns.  There is constant demand as the hospital's maternity department is nearby.  Natalya attracts customers with the high quality of her merchandise and reasonable prices.

Natalya is asking to be given a loan of 5,000 hryven to buy merchandise and increase her assortment of spring clothing.  Natalya's goal is to increase her inventory turnover, which will allow her to buy merchandise at lower prices.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of spring wear

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, en esta ocasión comprara maíz y leña, para mantener lo necesario en la vivienda ya que estos materiales son los principales para hacer las tortillas. Blanca considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado para superarse en sus ventas.
Ella ha mejorado su condición de vida y la de su familia, comenta que su negocio se ha ido desarrollando y que tiene más clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a loan again.  This time she will buy corn and firewood in order to keep what she needs at home because these are the main materials to make the tortillas.  

Blanca feels that these loans have helped her to improve herself with her sales.  She has improved her living conditions and those of her family.  She says that her business has been developing, and she has more customers.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewoood.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old, single and a businessman. He has been selling spare parts for the past one year with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.


He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy more spare parts for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand the business further. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old and is married with 3 children. She runs a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Ann has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 30 years old, is a woman with a happy personality. She works hard to support her family. Although she has experienced financial hardships, she still has a positive attitude. Janet is married and blessed with three children, which is a little bit difficult to manage, especially since they are still young. But Janet is very patient. She is full of hope that her children will be her hands in the future to lift the family from poverty.

Janet is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fresh pork, beef and chicken to sell in the market. This would help her to gain good profit and to save for her children's future. Janet just hopes that someday she will also achieve a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fresh pork, beef and chicken

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Due to the hardships of life, Mary Jane daily uses their motorcycle transport to help her husband in generating income. She is now 25 years old and has two infant children. They plan to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities and save for the future of their children. Despite problems and difficulties they have encountered in life, they still have the determination to uplift their standard of living. 

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy spare parts, tires and gasoline needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and give their family a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires and gasoline needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Ngok

texts.en:
Ngok lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Ngok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,200 in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking mother of two. She is 28 years old and married to a farmer. The family lives in the peaceful village of Solana. To add to her spouse's income, Liezel raises hogs to fatten and breed, and then sell to butchers in the future. Through her income, she allotted funds to save for emergency purposes.

As of now, she has had insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy vitamins and feed for hog sustainability. She would like to ensure proper growth of her hogs so that she can offer them at higher cost.

Someday, Liezel would like to have a stable hog raising business that will lead to the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for hog sustainability.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон трудолюбивый и умный человек. Рахмон женат и на воспитании имеет семерых детей. Более 6 месяцев он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Жена занимается домохозяйством, а сын помогает по бизнесу. Рахмон запрашивает займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью пополнения оборотного капитал. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Rahmon is a hardworking and smart man.  Rahmon is married and is raising seven children.  For over 6 months he has been selling groceries.  His wife takes care of the household and his son helps with the business.  Rahmon is requesting a loan to buy grocery goods with the goal of augmenting his working capital.  He is relying on your help and charity.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ruth Idania

texts.es:
Ruth, desea continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de pantalones jeans, camisas, faldas, y aretes, cadenas, pulseras, para poder surtir y diversificar el negocio con nuevos productos, con esta ayuda podrá seguir atendiendo a los clientes y mejorando su nivel de ventas.
Ella comenta que hasta el momento ha crecido con el negocio y que espera que este nuevo préstamo sea una buena inversión y cancelarlo a tiempo.
texts.en:
Ruth wishes to continue investing in the business.  That is why she is requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy pants, jeans, shirts, skirts, earrings, chains, and bracelets.  She will do this in order to be able to stock and diversify the business with new products.  With this help she will be able to continue serving her customers and improving her level of sales.

She says that so far she has grown with the business.  She expects that this new loan will be a good investment, and she will repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy pants, jeans, shirts, skirts, earrings, chains, and bracelets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rachiel

texts.en:
Rachiel lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for 2 years. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children; three of them are still in school. 

Rachiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is a 40-year-old businesswoman. She is married with three children. She has been running a chemist shop for the past 14 years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

Sicily is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy a stock of drugs. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to stock her business, which will help her improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a stock of drugs.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is married with four children aged between 7 and 16. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, seeds and suport labor.

loans.name: Juana Ruth

texts.es:
Juana emprendedora, sus planes mejora las condiciones de vida, realizarle cambios de infraestructura a su negocio y casa, junto a su esposo comercializan y elaboran productos metalúrgicos desde hace tiempo tiene el negocio siendo el principal ingreso económico de la familia, ampliarlo y colocar otros puntos de venta son proyectos a largo plazo. Con el préstamo anterior invirtió en el negocio produciendo mayores cantidades de productos. 
En este ciclo de préstamo compra materia prima como: marcos de cama, resortes, pintura, soldadura, entre otros materiales que se requieren para la elaboraciones de cama, cocinas de carbón, cocina industriales de uno o más quemadores para abastecer el negocio y cumplir con pedidos.
texts.en: Juana, an entrepreneur, plans to improve her living conditions by making changes to the infrastructure of her business and her home.  She and her husband make and sell metallurgic products.  This business has been the family’s main source of income for some time and their long-term projects include expanding and setting up other sales outlets.  They invested the previous loan in the business and produced larger quantities of products.  In this loan cycle, they will purchase raw material such as bed frames, springs, paint, solder, and other materials required for making beds, as well as coal stoves, and industrial stoves with one or two burners in order to supply the business and fill orders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the manufacture of beds.

loans.name: Santos Mauricio

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su hija y su madre, la casa es familiar, él se dedica a las labores agrícolas, sembrando maíz y criando cerdos, tiene 8 años de estar en esta actividad, de la cual ha logrado mantener a su familia y cubrir las necesidades más urgentes del hogar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para el pago de alquiler de terreno y compra de insumos como el abono y los herbicidas, ya que está iniciando su trabajo en la siembra de este ciclo, lo que será un gran aporte la compra que se menciona con los fondos del préstamo.
El objetivo de Santos es realizar una buena labor, sembrar el maíz y obtener buenas cosechas, tambien ampliar la granja de cerdos.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his daughter and his mother in their family home. He's a farmer who sows corn and raises pigs. He has been in this business for eight years. It has allowed him to support his family and to pay for the most urgent needs in his home.
He requests the loan in order to pay for rent on the land and to purchase supplies such as fertilizer and herbicide. He's beginning to sow the next cycle, so it will be a great contribution to make this purchase with the funds from the loan.
Santos's goal is to do a good job, sow the corn and get a good crop, and also to expand his pig farm.

loans.use: to pay for rent on the land and to purchase fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Loyakaru

texts.en:
Loyakaru is 69 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 20,18,16 and 14 years. He sells livestock, a business he has been doing for the past nine years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

He wants to purchase more livestock for the growth of his business and has requested a loan worth KES 20,000. 

The anticipated profit will help him purchase a plot of land for his livestock. His dream is to see his business grow as well as have his family live comfortably. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, 28, used the previous loan to buy shoes for resale. She has challenges of inadequate capital to meet customer demand and high transportation costs. Her family dream is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand into new markets. 

Aisha intends to buy second hand shoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Муж является плотником. Более 2-х лет она занимается купле- продажей скота. Она начинала бизнес с купли- продажи мелкого рогатого скота, а сейчас имеет несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Имеет хороший опыт работы в данной сфере бизнеса и имеет хорошие условия на содержании скота. Мохира запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mohira is a hardworking and good woman.  She is married and the loving mother of three children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  For over two years she has been selling cattle.  She began her business selling sheep and goats, but now she has several head of cattle.  She has She has valuable experience in this type of business and she has a good environment for keeping her cattle.  Mohira is requesting the loan to expand her business by purchasing cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 52 years old and is married with 4 children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Fatuma has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 35,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and carrots to sell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is married with one child who is one and a half years old. The child is still young to be enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 48 years of age, manages a sari-sari (general store) business. She sells beverages, shampoo, biscuits, and drinks. She has been in this business for almost two years.

Rosita has learned that the more items she buys for resale, the more customers she gained. So, she is asking for additional working capital amounting to PHP 15,000 from ASKI to buy additional grocery items, such as eggs, soap and candies. In this way, she can satisfy her customers. She is hoping that through the loan, she will reap higher income from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, such as eggs, soap and candies.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, es soltero,  vive con sus padres, es agricultor, sembrando maíz, frijol y café, trabaja desde hace varios años, junto a su padre, inician labores desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y compra de semilla, abono y herbicidas, con estos recursos podrá iniciar el trabajo y tener lo necesario para que se realice el proceso correcto.
La aspiración de Roberto es ser independiente en sus cultivos, crecer y tener sus propias cosechas.
texts.en:
Roberto is single and lives with his parents. He is a farmer who grows corn, beans, and coffee. Roberto has worked for several years with his father. They begin their work at 6am and continue until 3pm.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labor for preparing the land, as well as pay for seeds, compost, and herbicides. With these resources, he will be able to begin his work and have what he needs to follow the correct process. Roberto aspires to work independently with his crops so that he can grow and have his own harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy seeds, compost, and herbicides.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has six children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,200 in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has two children; neither of them are still in school. 

Adau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,200 in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Gelber Mauricio

texts.es:
Gelber, es agricultor, vive con su madre y sus abuelos, él está dedicado al cultivo de hortalizas, tiene tres años en esta actividad, siembra pepinos, tomates y chiles, trabaja a tiempo completo, aprendió este oficio por su abuelo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de semilla de pepino y compra de fertilizantes, con esta ayuda podrá iniciar la nueva siembra y aplicar lo necesario para ver la cosecha abundante. 
La aspiración de Gelber es aumentar la producción, tener clientes a quienes vender la producción de manera definida, tambien tener mayor terreno.
texts.en:
Gelber is a farmer who lives with his mother and grandparents. He grows vegetables and has been in this business for three years. Gelber grows cucumbers, tomatoes, and chile peppers. He works full-time and learned this trade from his grandfather.

Gelber is currently requesting a loan to use for buying cucumber seeds and fertilizers. With this assistance, he will be able to start a new crop and apply what he needs to achieve an abundant harvest. Gelber aspires to increase production and to have customers to whom he can sell what he produces on a regular basis. In addition, he wants to have more land.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido a solicitar otro préstamo, porque quiere aumentar las ventas en el negocio, para eso comprara productos como tomates, cebollas, maíz, aceite, condimentos, y una parte de leña, para preparar tortillas y por las tardes pasteles y antojitos, ya que esto le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de los productos y en la leña al comprarla en efectivo le ayudara para encontrarla a menor precio.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo del préstamo anterior, porque realizo la compra necesaria para mejorar la atención a los clientes en la venta de tortillas, la cual ha sido muy útil para que sus ventas aumentaran, con esta inversion quiere ofrecer un rubro mas a los clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided to request another loan because she wants to expand her sales in her business.  She will buy products such as tomatoes, onions, corn, oil, seasonings, and a portion of firewood to make tortillas and, in the afternoon, meat pies and snacks.  This will help her have the necessary materials to make the products.  For the firewood, buying it in cash will help her get a better price.

She says the previous loan had a positive effect because she made the necessary purchase to improve her customer service selling tortillas.  This has been very useful for increasing her sales.  With this loan she wants to offer another line to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, corn, oil, seasonings, and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, coffee, cocoa, olive oil, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Isaac Wamai

texts.en:
Isaac is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Isaac will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar and maize flour for resale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to  buy rice, sugar and maize flour for resale.
